Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: KULAK STANZA
Indra, moon-god and wind-god silently remembered the Lord.411.
The Yakshas, birds and oceans wer raising tumult in astonishment.412.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਸਮੁੰਦਰ ਸੁਕੜ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ (ਅਥਵਾ ਸੰਸੇ ਵਿਚ ਪੈ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ)

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: The sea alongwith his powers was visualizing that God of gods and mysterious Lord.413.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਭੇਦ ਨਾ ਮਿਲਣ ਕਾਰਨ ਅਕ ਗਏ ਹਨ ॥੪੧੩॥
ਯੋਗ ਨੂੰ ਵੇਖ ਕੇ ਭੋਗ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲੇ (ਸੰਸਾਰੀ ਲੋਗ)

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: Seeing these Yogis, the pleasures and sexual enjoyments were getting illusioned in wonder.414.
Forsaking their arms, weapons and canopies, the people were falling at the feet of these sages.415.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਸੂਰਜ ਭੈ ਨਾਲ ਭਰ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ ॥੪੧੫॥

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: Th musical instruments were being played
There was the sound of thunderous music and the songs were being sung.416.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਖੁਸ਼ੀ ਦੀ ਅਵਸਥਾ ਪ੍ਰਗਟ ਹੁੰਦੀ ਹੈ ॥੪੧੬॥

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: The god Surya and the heavenly damsels leaving their self-restraint, were getting pleased with them.417.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਪੰਛੀ (ਆਕਾਸ਼ ਵਿਚ) ਘੁੰਮ ਫਿਰ ਰਹੇ ਹਨ,
ਰਾਜੇ (ਇਕ ਦੂਜੇ ਨਾਲ) ਭਿੜ ਰਹੇ ਹਨ,

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: Seeing hem the Yakshas and birds were getting pleased and there was a run amongst the kings for their sight.418.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਰਿਸ਼ੀ ਦੇ ਨਵੇਂ ਸਰੂਪ ਨੂੰ ਵੇਖ ਕੇ (ਇਹ ਦਸ਼ਾ ਹੋ ਰਹੀ ਹੈ।) ॥੪੧੮॥

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: CHARPAT STANZA
These Yogis who had been immersed in Yoga and who had withdrawn from all enjoyments,
Had been wearing the ochre-colored clothes of various countries. 419.
These Yogis of firm conduct and sinless Karmas had abandoned all enjoyments.420.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਮਾੜੇ ਕੰਮਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਨਸ਼ਟ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲਾ ਹੈ,

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: These vow-observing Yogis of good conduct and sinless Karmas had given up all evil actions.421.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਚੰਗੀ ਚਾਲ ਅਥਵਾ ਮਰਯਾਦਾ ਵਾਲਾ ਹੈ ॥੪੨੧॥

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: These were the people who had destroyed attachment and deceit and

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਮੋਹ ਨੂੰ ਮਲ ਸੁਟਣ ਵਾਲਾ ਹੈ,

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: Performers of good actions like the waters of all the sacred rivers.422.
They were kind-hearted people, wearing ochre-coloured clothes,
Purifying all the countries far and near were the destroyers of evil actions.423.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਮਾੜੇ ਕਰਮਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਨਸ਼ਟ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲਾ ਹੈ ॥੪੨੩॥

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: Seeing their radiance even the sun was wonder-struck
And someone out of them was repeating the Name of the Lord, and someone was singing the Praises of the Lord.424.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਇਕ ਦੀ ਹੀ ਸਥਾਪਨਾ ਕਰ ਰਹੇ ਹਨ ॥੪੨੪॥

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: While remembering and repeating the Name of the Lord,

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਇਕ (ਪਰਮ ਸੱਤਾ) ਦੇ ਜਾਪ ਜਪਣ ਵਿਚ

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: They were firmly establishing the Lord in their mind.425.
The horns were being sounded and there was the singing of Ragas (musical modes)
The Name of the Lord was being repeated, which had frightened the sins.426.
The moon was wondering and Indra, seeing their devotion, had been fearful
All the gods were looking at them.427.
The ghosts, fiends and ganas, seeing their beauty were wonder-struck
And all were thinking about them with sincerity.428.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: (ਉਸ ਤੋਤੇ ਨੂੰ ਪਿੰਜਰੇ ਵਿਚੋਂ ਕਢ ਦਿੱਤਾ ਅਤੇ) ਉਹ ਝਟਪਟ ਉਡ ਗਿਆ,

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: The Yogi Dut saw there a parrot, who was released from bondage and immediately flew away.429.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: (ਇਸ ਤਰ੍ਹਾਂ) ਆਤਮਾ ਵੀ ਭਰਮ ਵਿਚ ਜੁਟੀ ਹੋਈ ਹੈ ॥੪੨੯॥
ਕਿ ਇਹ ਮੇਰਾ ਉਨ੍ਹੀਵਾਂ ਗੁਰੂ ('ਸੀਸੰ') ਹੈ

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: As soon as the pious Dutt saw him, he flew away and made known to Dutt this secret that the action-prone man with ten senses and none doors was superior amongst beings.430.
He is the abode of wisdom, but falling in the attachment of his wife etc. he remains in illusion.431.
The individual entrapped in the key of wisdom and mildness, he is absorbed in pleasure and is removed far away from Dharma.432.
His wisdom seized by the attachment of mother, wife, sons and brothers.433.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਪੁੱਤਰ ਅਤੇ ਭਰਾ ਦੇ ਮੋਹ ਕਰ ਕੇ ॥੪੩੩॥

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: Engrossed in lust, he is absorbed in attachments and burning in the fire of anger, he is occupied in the collection of wealth.434.
On getting an opportunity, he destroys the great warriors for his self-interest and in this way, he falls into hell.435.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਤਦ ਪ੍ਰਭੂ ਨੂੰ ਚੰਗਾ ਲਗਦਾ ਹੈ

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: If forsaking all, the Lord is adored with sincerity, and then all the sufferings and malice come to an end.436.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਧਨ ਦੌਲਤ ਨੂੰ ਛਡ ਦਿੰਦਾ ਹੈ,
(ਤਦ ਉਹ) ਕਰਮਾਂ ਵਿਚ ਸਫਲ ਹੋ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: If the being relinquishes all like the abandonment of the cage by parrot, then all his actions can bear fruit and he achieves the position of superiority.437.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਅਤੇ ਸਾਰੇ (ਸੁਖ) ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ ਕਰ ਲੈਂਦਾ ਹੈ ॥੪੩੭॥

lines.gurmukhi: ieiq nilnI suk aunIsvo gurU brnnµ ]19]

Dr. Surinder Singh Kohli.translation: End of the description of the adoption of the Parrot as the Nineteenth Guru.

Dr. Rattan Singh Jaggi.translation: ਇਥੇ 'ਨਲਨੀ ਸੁਕ' ਉਨ੍ਹੀਵੇਂ ਗੁਰੂ ਦਾ ਵਰਣਨ ਸਮਾਪਤ ॥੧੯॥
